Munkhzul is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts from Korea in order to expand his business by opening a second shop. As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his family and invest in his children's university education. The borrower is very hardworking individual who values his family above all.

loans.use: to open a second automobile spare parts shop

loans.name: Agapi

texts.en: Agapi, a 23-year-old young lady with a nice Greek name, lives with parents and brother in Ijevan city. Agapi works in Ijevan city municipality as a specialist in community land tax.  At the same time, Agapi and her family are engaged in farming. They breed cows and pigs and grow vegetables in their garden. Agapi says that to meet family needs just with their salary is very hard so they must work hard day and night to sustain their family. Agapi likes farming and does that occupation with pleasure. The agricultural products Agapi’s father sells in Ijevan food markets. Agapi and her family are asking from Kiva lenders a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy four young cows and hope to receive more profit from their animal breeding.

loans.use: to buy four young cows

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 46-year-old lady from Migori county. She supports four people in her family and is a widow. She has four children who are, 24, 21, 18, and 14 years old respectively.

She has a boutique which she has been operating for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase rollers and handbags for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to grow the business.

Her dreams are to become a stable business lady and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase rollers and bags for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and is the father of 3 children. Ali works hard to provide his family's needs while his wife takes care of their children.

Ali is a mechanic. He specializes in fixing the damaged parts of the structure of any vehicle. He has been in this field for 15 years and has established his own business in 2001.  Ali has 2 employees hired and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work as well as to install extra shelves in his garage. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work as well as to install extra shelves in his garage

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 34-year-old woman. She is a nurse by profession, while her husband owns an electrical goods shop in the market. They live in a poor community where the sanitation problem is at its peak. 

Shagufta's husband is interested in purchasing a variety of electrical goods for the shop. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase electrical items such as cables, bulbs, wires, switches, holders, etc. to sell. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. 

With the help of the profit amount, Shagufta wants to purchase a house in a new area where they can sustain their life in a neat and clean environment. Shagufta is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, aged 34 years, is married and has five children. Her husband operates a butcher shop, and he contributes to the upkeep of their children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past eight years, Mwaka has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business, and apart from that she operates a goat meat selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs (KES) 20,000, she wants to purchase livestock for slaughter for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter for meat sale.

loans.name: Asanbek

texts.ru:
Асанбеку  49 лет, имеет 4 детей. Асанбек в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес с 5 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Асанбека, на данный момент в его хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, земля в 1,8 га засажена семенным картофелем и многолетними травами. Также, Асанбек оказывает строительные услуги.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асанбек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого рогатого скота и минеральных удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Асанбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Asanbek is 49 years old and has four children. As a main source of income for his family, he raises livestock and grows produce, having launched this business by buying five sheep. Thanks to Asanbek’s hard work, his farm at present includes two cows; he grows potatoes and perennials on a land plot of 1.8 ha [about 4.5 acres]. Asanbek also works as building contractor.
In order to develop his business further, Asanbek  applied to the”Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS intended for buying small livestock and mineral fertilizers. Asanbek plans to invest the resulting revenues into a further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha, aged 35 years, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Furaha has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators. 

With the loan of Kshs (KES) 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula, aged 42 years, is married to Mwanyoha, who is a teacher. Together they have ten children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyamvula has operated a vegetable and fruit-selling business for the past five years. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit-vending business in the area in order to raise her profits.

For that reason, she wants to use the Kshs (KES) 50,000 to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaw.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience has operated a food vending business for the past years, cooking chapati (flat bread) rice and beans. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 24, is from Migori. She is a single mother of four children who are eight, six, four and two years old, respectively.

She has a beauty salon in the Migori market which she has been running for the last two years, and she makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more plastic seats and one blow drier. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business.

Her dream is to become financially stable through her current business and open another outlet so that she can better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic seats and one blow drier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Khureltulga

texts.en:
Mr. Khureltulga, 28 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Seven months ago, he was employed as a driver at a private business entity. Before this job, he had been working at a military base for nine years. His wife has been working as a waitress at a restaurant since 2008. 

Khureltulga is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT to purchase an electric car for a taxi service. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen.

During his free time, he can render taxi services to local people as an additional income source. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Doña Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, actualmente vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa que alquilan, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos que es el negocio que posee desde hace ya vario años por lo que tiene una buena clientela con quienes logra que sus ventas sean numerosas, doña carmen solicita un credito para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como: zapatos, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, etc. y así engrandecer el inventario, para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carmen’s a very hardworking, responsible woman.  She currently lives with her husband and two children in a rented house.  She works selling clothes and shoes, a business she’s had for several years now so she has a good clientele that leads to numerous sales.  

Carmen is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like shoes, skirts, pants, underwear for women and men, etc. to stock her business thus enlarging her inventory to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía, de 53 años de edad , es viuda hace 20 años, tiene 7 hijos, pero sólo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia.Desde hace 30 años, se dedica a cultivar papa, cebada, olluco y habas, también cría animales como carnero, vaca, cerdo, asno, gallinas y cuy, las cuales vende para cubrir alguna eventualidad que se le presente o para hacer sus compras semanales en el mercado, cuenta que a muchos de ellos los mata para festejar alguna fecha importante, como se suelen hacer en su localidad pero lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de los campos siempre verdes, y saber que sus cultivos están bien cuidados, está emprendedora persona se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus animales y luego de preparar sus alimentos, sale a trabajar con la ayuda de sus hijos, para más adelante instalar un negocio de productos comestibles y verduras en su casa recién construida.
Rosalía, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 53, has been a widow for 20 years.  She has seven children but only two of them still live with her in her own house.   

She’s been growing potatoes, barley, ‘olluco’ [a tuber] and broad beans for 30 years and also raises animals like lambs, cows, pigs, asses, chickens and guinea pigs that she sells to cover expenses that crop up occasionally or to do her weekly market purchases.  She relates that she butchers many of them to celebrate important dates like is usual in her community.  

What she enjoys the most is the countryside that’s always green and to know that her crops are well cared for.  This enterprising woman wakes up at five in the morning to tend to her animals and then prepare her meals.  She heads out to work with her children’s help in order to set up a business selling foodstuffs and vegetables in her house she’s recently built.  Rosalía will use the 500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy runs a motorcycle transport business taking passersby and town dwellers from one place to another. Her main challenge is trying to drive her customers around during the rainy season.

Mercy joined Yehu to access loans for her business. She is applying for a 30,000 KES loan which she wants to use to establish a vegetable stall where she will sell green vegetables and potatoes. She is appreciative of her previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to establish a vegetable stall.

loans.name: Nazmije

texts.en:
Nazmije is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works for Kosovo Energy Corporation, which is main source of income for the family.  Nazmije raises milk cows. 

Nazmije is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a milk cow. She wants to expand her farm in the future and save for her youngest child’s university expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a 36-year-old widow who has three children whose ages are ten, six and three years old. For the last five years she has operated a grocery shop close by her home and earns 6,860 KES a month.

Sheila is applying for another loan through KADET LTD, this one for 40,000 KES which she will use to stock up on sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and soft drinks. She will put her anticipated profits back into her business.

Sheila’s ambition is to move into wholesale and support her children.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is happy and grateful for the loans she has previously received through Milango. Her business has continued to improve, but she needs more money to grow it.

Ega is therefore applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy fabric, sewing machines and thread for sewing. She believes her business will be profitable enough to meet the required repayments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing machines and thread.

loans.name: Ymri

texts.en:
KosInvest loans have provided the Ashkali Community of Kosovo with opportunities to improve their lives and businesses. The people there have been able to improve their enterprises and create working environments. The area where the Ashkali community lives is better today than it was in the past.

One of the people who has benefited is Ymri, a 33-year-old father of four children ranging in age from 13 to 3 years old. Ymri works as a butcher, his family’s main source of income. Although he has been in his business for a long time, he doesn't earn enough to fully support the needs of his family.

Ymri is therefore requesting this loan to buy construction materials to finish a second floor in his house. His goal is to complete the work so his family will have more space and better security. Ymri wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their help!

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Ghulam

texts.en:
Ghulam is 45-year-old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He has been selling shoe boxes for many years. This business is very productive for his family, therefore he is interested to grow his business. For that he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cardboard and glue for making shoe boxes. Ghulam wants to reconstruct his house, with the profits because the condition of his house is very poor.

He hopes that the loan amount will helpful for his business growth. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cardboard and glue for making shoe boxes.

loans.name: Susy

texts.en:
Susy is 55 years old. She supports two other people in her family and is married to Benson, who is a farmer, and is a mother of four children who are 33, 27, 23 and 15 years old.

She has a retail shop which deals mostly with soft drinks; she has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 6,450 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She has applied for her third loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more soft drinks like soda for sale.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hope is to run a successful business and take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Zoila quien  con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas como harina, queso, sal, grasas, huevos en mayores cantidades, con los cuales ganó descuentos y aumentó su producción. Zoila dice a su financiadores “Gracias por su colaboración, pude cumplir con mis metas y por la tasa adquirida con el crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará Materiales para aumentar una vez mas su producción, como harina, grasas y lácteos, con ello preparará tortas y panes alusivos al dia de las madres, las cuales están encargadas..
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Zoila, who with her previous loan on Kiva purchased materials such as flour, cheese, salt, oils, and eggs in larger quantities. She was able to get a discount on these purchases and increase production. Zoila says to the lenders: "Thank you for working with me. I was able to achieve my goals because of the rate I got with the loan." She is now applying for a new loan with which she will purchase materials to increase her production again, such as flour, oils, and dairy products. With these ingredients, she will prepare cakes and bread for mothers' day. These items have been pre-ordered.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to increase production, such as flour, oil, and dairy products.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a retail shop where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Jocelyne est jeune dame de 27ans. Célibataire, elle a 01 enfant de 07ans en charge. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend depuis 2009 des pagnes, des parfums et autres produits de façon ambulante à ses clients.  Manquant de fonds pour répondre aux besoins de ces derniers, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (produits de beauté, pagnes). A l’avenir, madame Jocelyne voudrait avec le profit agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir de son enfant.
texts.en: Jocelyne is a young 27-year-old woman. She is single with one child, age 7, to care for. In order to cover her family's needs, she has been re-selling traditional cloths, perfumes, and other products since 2009. She sells door-to-door. Since she does not have the funds to respond to customer demand, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES for the purchase of merchandise (beauty products and traditional cloths). In the future, Jocelyne would like to use her profits to expand her business and ensure her child's future.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloths and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stocks like maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 31 years old and from the Migori region. He is married to Everline and supports two people in her family. He has two children who are five and three years old.

He has a bakery where he produces local breads and snacks. He has been doing this business for the last eight years and comfortably makes a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He is taking his third loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to purchase an oven, which will make the business become stable in terms of production hence providing more income. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to grow the current business to become large enough and support his family by giving them the best education.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Don Julio de 39 años de edad es un hombre trabajador y responsable vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus 6 hijos, actualmente se de dedica hacer viajes en su pick up en los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, que es lo que le genera ganancias para su bolsillo y de la misma manera es de la forma en que logra satisfacer sus necesidades diarias básicas, Don Julio solicita un credito para la compra de materiales como cemento, arena, ladrillos, etc. para construir unos cuartos para sus hijos ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo.
texts.en: Julio, 39, is a hardworking, responsible man living in his own house with his life companion and their six children.  He currently works making trips to local markets near his house in his pick-up truck generating income both for his own pocket and to cover basic daily household expenses.  Julio is requesting a loan to buy building supplies like cement, sand, bricks, etc., to add some rooms for his children because he’s been unable to do so because what he earns isn’t enough.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rina Maribel

texts.es: Doña Rina de 40 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y muy trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo de 15 y 13 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. que es un negocio que ella considera que le deja buenas ganancias para sus necesidades, Doña Rina esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales como cementos, arenas, ladrillos etc. para la construcción de un muro que piensa realizar enfrente de su casa y tambien para  poder pagar la mano de obra y asi puedan vivir mas seguros ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rina is 40, responsible, and hardworking. She lives in her own house with her two sons, ages 15 and 13, who are students. She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, and more. The business generates a good income to meet her needs. 

Rina has applied for a loan to buy materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and more to build a wall at the front of her house and to pay laborers. This way, she and her family will be able to live safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc.

loans.name: Ana Joaquina

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad luchadora, con muchas fuerzas y con el deseo de salir adelante. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa la cual agradece a DIOS y a sus padres por haberle brindado la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un grado de conocimiento básico. Su estado civil es en unión libre y junto a su pareja se dedican al cultivo de hortaliza y granos básicos como lo es la papa, maíz y frijoles. De su relación tienen 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad el mayor con 3 años y medio y el otro de 2 años y medio. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y que además también se dedica al comercio la venta de tortilla la cual es realizada en el mercado de la zona. Su pareja es quien la apoya en todos los aspectos el se hace cargo del cultivo y del mantenimiento en su ausencia mientras ella vende tortillas.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa, compra de fertilizantes, abono y una bomba para fumigación a su producto para que ayude a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda y cultivar más hortaliza; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro ya que ella no quiere que pasen por la misma situación que ella paso.
texts.en:
Ana is a young, 23-year-old woman who strives hard wanting to get ahead.  She completed elementary school and she thanks God and her parents for having given her the opportunity to study and learn the basics.  

She’s in a common law relationship and she and her spouse work growing vegetables and basic grains like potatoes, corn and beans.  Her relationship has produced two children who are minors, the oldest is three and the other one is two-and-a-half.  She has much experience because her parents taught her to work the land when she was a little girl.  She also works in commerce selling tortillas in the local market.  Her spouse supports her in all aspects and he takes care of all crop maintenance when she’s away selling tortillas.

At present, she’s asking for a loan to invest in the potato crop; she will buy fertilizer, manure and a pump to fumigate her product to keep it healthy and free of infestations.

Her dream is to be able to improve her house and grow more vegetables but her priority is to see her children become professionals with a better education and a better future because she doesn’t want them to go through the same situation she did.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her potato crop.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: La Sra. Reyna tiene 24 años,  que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de comida pero en esta ocacion porque se acerca el dia de la madre vendera ropa según la temporada, pero su actividad principal es la venta de comida tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona Huahicani, este préstamo es su  segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Reyna va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca el día de la Madre y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Reyna enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Reyna se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is 24. She main activity is selling prepared foods, but she will be selling clothing as well because Mother's Day is near. Her food stand is located in Huahicani. This will be her second loan cycle with the institution. Reyna will use the loan to buy wholesale clothing like sweaters and vests to stock her business for Mother's Day. Sales are excellent at this time, and she takes orders. She is applying for a loan because she lacks capital. 

Reyna faces stiff competition each day. She will use her profits to improve her stand. She wants to offer her customers a variety of merchandise. Reyna is happy and grateful to the institution for its support, which helps her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
For over ten years, Omari has operated a liquor-selling business; his potential customers are dwellers near the market and neighbors. In addition, he also operates a poultry-selling business, from which he earns his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the Kshs (KES) 50,000, he wants to purchase a stock of liquor and poultry for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, and he thanks Kiva and Yehu for the help.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of liquor and poultry for resale.

loans.name: Damilde

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Damilse quien con su credikiva. Pues con él pudo comprar ropa y calzado respondiendo a los pedidos de sus clientes, quienes quedaron muy satisfechos. Su negocio con esta inversión ha logrado mayor liquidez, aumentó su capital de trabajo, obtuvo nuevos clientes, mas cuentas por cobrar y esto ha redundado en mayores ingresos,  que benefician su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo  credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cosméticos, perfumes, platería, para una vez mas , ser oportunos con sus clientes,  especialmente en el día de las madres, pues estos quieren sorprender con regalos a este ser maravilloso llamado Madre. Su mensaje a os financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida, con este apoyo he progresado bastante en mi negocio, sigan apoyándome”
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Damilse who was able to use her Kiva loan to buy clothes and shoes thus filling her customers’ orders; they were very satisfied.  This investment led to increased liquidity in her business, her working capital increased, she gained new customers and had more accounts receivable which led to higher income that benefited her home.

She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, perfume and silver jewelry so that once again she can fill customer orders in a timely fashion, especially for Mother’s Day, because they want to surprise this wonderful being called ‘Mother’ with gifts.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “I am very grateful.  My business has made much progress thanks to this support.  Continue supporting me.”

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, perfume and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi, de 28 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia cerca de la carretera de su pueblo en la sierra del Perú.Su pesada labor empieza a las 3 de la mañana ya que siembra arveja, papa, maíz y flor de gladiolos, paralelamente elabora panes las cuales comercializa desde las 6 de la mañana en su pueblo; ella entre carcajadas comenta que la panadería le deja ingresos económicos diarios, mientras que la agricultura es por temporadas  pero les permite comprar algunas cosas de primera necesidad e incluso ahorrar por el bienestar de sus hijos ya que desea comprar más terrenos y sembrar en mayor cantidad, además quiere comprar otro asno para trasladar sin problemas sus herramientas y materiales agrícolas.Este es el cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero recibido y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Daysi, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues comenzará la cosecha.
texts.en:
Daysi, 28, lives with her two children in her own house near her town’s highway in the Peruvian mountains.  Her heavy work starts at three in the morning because she grows peas, potatoes, corn and gladiola flowers; she also bakes bread that she starts selling in town at six in the morning.  

With much laughter she comments that the bakery produces daily income while the agriculture is seasonal but they are able to buy basic need items and even save up for their children’s well-being because she wants to buy more land and plant larger amounts.  She also wants to buy another ass to transport her tools and farm supplies problem-free.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she feels very happy with the financial support she’s gotten and commits to make her payments punctually.  Daysi will use the 2,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops because harvest season is starting.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Norkul

texts.en:
Norkul is a kind and smart man. He has four children. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to his children. 

Norkul began his own business, dealing in animal husbandry, seven years ago. He has an additional business with selling food items. He goes every week to the central market and buys food items and cattle. He then brings them to his house and sells at the market, which is in his village. 

He requested a loan in the amount of 850 USD to buy building materials, as his house is in bad condition. He must repair all the rooms of his house, and that’s why he needs to buy paint, cement, wood, etc. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, wood, etc. for repairing his house.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 59-year-old father of five adult children who lives with his family in the village. He is the only financial provider for the family and works as a cleaner in a private company.

Ismail has a livestock business raising cows and calves. He sells milk to dairy farms and baby animals to the local market. He is busy every day because he is keeping two jobs, which helps him to be in good health, he explained.

The loan of 100,000 Euros that Ismail is requesting from KosInvest is to buy another cow and a calf. The loan will help him to generate more income by selling milk and milk products. In the future, he wants to expand his farm. His goal is to employ others as he expands his business, and this will happen soon, as Ismail says.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Jonathan Gerardo

texts.es: Jonathan, está casado, tiene la edad de 27 años y posee dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos y fumigaciones para mejorar su cafetal. El se a dedicado desde varios años atrás a trabajar con este cultivo por lo cual ve favorable asistirlo para mejorarlo. Además quiere también repoblar su plantación con nuevas plantas para aumentar sus próximas cosechas. El espera recibir de su cafetal el máximo de las ganancias para salir adelante con sus pagos y mejorar cada día su estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jonathan is married.  He’s 27-years-old and has two children who are his main priority.  

He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure and fumigation to improve his coffee crops.  He’s worked for several years growing this crop so he feels it’s favorable to give it maintenance in order to improve it.  He also wants to repopulate his plantation with new plants in order to increase future crop yields.  He hopes his coffee plantation will produce the maximum profits so he can make his payments and improve his economic stability every day.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous banks with state banks and Fudecosur has given him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 58 años de edad vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Gabriel de 62 años .Desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de papa, olluco, maíz y alverja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia ademas de criar cuyes y gallinas . Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de su localidad, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción.Es el cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su actividad laboral.Marina, invertirá los 3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marina, 58, lives in her own house with her husband Gabriel, who is 62. She learned the family business as a girl; therefore, she grows potatoes, ullucus, corn, and vetch. This work provides the income she needs to support her family. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She sells her harvest at wholesale in the local market, where she gets the best prices.

She loves working the land and does so with great care. She has been doing this work for 36 years. Transporting her merchandise to the wholesale markets is the most difficult chore, as drivers are very scarce in her area. Over time, she would like to buy more land to increase production.

This is her fourth loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding for her work. Marina will use the 3500 soles to buy organic fertilizer for her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 26 and from Kisumu. She is married to Harry and has three children who are ten, eight and four years old.

For the last five years Caroline has run a beauty salon where, in addition to doing hair, she carries a variety of cosmetics. She earns approximately 10,000 KES a month.

Caroline is applying for a second loan through KADET LTD, this one for 40,000 KES which she will use to buy more cosmetics to sell. She will put her anticipated profits back into her business.

Caroline’s ambition is to open another salon so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 28 years old and has three children. One of her daughters goes to school while the others are still too young to attend.

Ly and her husband earn a living as welders. She has been a welder for five years, earning about 4,000,000 VND a month. Together, her husband and her total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND a month.

Ly has been a part of SEDA's credit program since 2008. She last borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. She is now applying for a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy welding tools. She is eager to expand her business and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy welding tools.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a married client from Iraq. He is 31 years old and has two children. Nabil is the only provider for his family.

Nabil owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and their accessories like mobile covers, headsets and batteries. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Nabil now has an employee hired and has gained good fame in the neighborhood, since he is the only person who also repairs mobiles in the area. 

Nabil is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. By paying his annual rent, Nabil believes that he will be able to grow his business and increase his profits. He will also be able to provide for all of his family's needs and improve their current financial condition.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu sells fruit and vegetables from a stall by her home to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells chickens. The weather is a challenge for her work as well as the high cost of transporting produce to her stall.

Saumu decided to join Yehu to access its business loans. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy sacks of fruit, mangoes and green vegetables, plus passion fruit so she can make fruit juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit, mangoes, passion fruit and green vegetables.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Doña Claudia es una señora trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en casa propia con su hija, actualmente se dedica a la venta de tortillas ya que es un negocio que le da como resultado buenas ganancias y que es muy buscado por sus vecino ya que es un producto de primera necesidad para todos diariamente, Doña Claudia solicita un credito para la compra de maíz por mayor para la elaboración de las tortillas y así seguir con su negocio para tener un mejor estabilidad economica con su hija.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who lives in her own house with her daughter. Currently she sells tortillas, as it is a business that provides her good earnings. Her product is much sought after by her neighbors, as each day, it is a basic household necessity for all.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale for making tortillas, so that she can continue with her business and have better financial stability for her and her daughter.

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a kiln and a display case.

loans.name: Miguelina Wencesla

texts.es: La Sra. Miguelina  tiene 29 años, casada tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 7, 4 y 2 años,   ella se dedica al  servicio costura de polleras para las cholitas, en su taller propio que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio en la zona de Calama, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Miguelina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una maquina recta para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  La Sra. Miguelina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas  y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de tela, La Sra. Miguelina  es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en:
Miguelina is 29 years old, married, and has three children, ages 7, 4 and 2. She sews traditional "cholita" skirts in her own workshop, located in her home in the Calama area. This is her second loan with the institution, and Miguelina is going to use it to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine for making her articles of clothing. 

Miguelina faces challenges in her business, such as lack of machines and sometimes material, depending on the work she has to carry out. She is going to use the profits to purchase fabric. Miguelina is a hard-working person whose wish is to have a larger workshop, hire labor and teach young people the trade of dressmaking.

loans.use: To buy a straight-stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana  Mercedes

texts.es: Doña ana viven en casa propia con su familia, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. doña ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materiales laminas, polinez, etc. y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que con lo que gana en su tienda no le alcanza para poder realizarlo y asi puedan vivir seguros sin ningun tipo de peligro.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her family. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman and has managed to raise her family. 

She owns a grocery shop, where she sells bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruit and sweets, as well as essential products like soap, shampoo and others. Her business is based from her house.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets, wooden beams and to pay for labour for the replacement of the roof of her house, since she cannot afford to do it with the income from her shop. This way they can live safely without any danger.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, wooden beams and to pay for labour

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo de 63 años de edad, es separado, su único hijo vive en Italia y el vive con sus inquilinos en su casa.
Cuando era joven trabajaba en la mina, una vez que se jubiló pensó en dedicarse a la siembra de papas, para de así mantenerse ocupado, esta actividad lo llena de alegría por ello trabaja despacio y tranquilo removiendo y alzando la tierra de sus padres.Todos los días se levanta a las 5 de la mañana, para que tranquilamente prepare sus alimentos  y a eso de las 10 o 11 de la mañana inicia sus labores agrícolas  , ya que de lograr cosechar selecciona las papas y las guarda en su depósito, para que cuando los compradores de semilla lo busquen, los pueda vender a un buen precio.Marcelo, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 63 and separated. His only son lives in Italy, and he lives with his tenants in his house. When he was young he worked in the mine, and once he retired he thought about growing potatoes to keep himself busy. 

This work fills him with joy, so he works slowly and calmly tilling his parents' land. Every day he gets up at 5 in the morning to calmly prepare his food, and at around 10 or 11 in the morning starts his farm work.  After he harvests, he sorts the potatoes and keeps them in his storage building, so that when the seed potato buyers seek him out, he can sell them at a good price. Marcelo will spend the 1500 soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería desde hace 3 años. Vende blusas, camisetas, pantalones, sandalias y otros que le soliciten sus clientes. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 16,000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio de mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros  y sandalias. El objetivo es incrementar el inventario de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su sueño es ser gran empresaria y mantener el negocio surtido.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old, and a widow. She has two children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. She has been selling merchandise for three years. She sells blouses, T-shirts, pants, sandals and other items that her customers ask for. She runs her business from her home. 

Now she has decided to request a loan of 16,000 lempiras so that she can stock her store with merchandise such as women's and men's clothing and sandals.

The aim is to increase her inventory of merchandise to sell to her customers. Her dream is to be a successful business person and to keep her business stocked.

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise such as women's and men's clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronics and grocery stock such as maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula, una señora esforzada en la vida para lograr salir adelante con sus 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya trabajan lo que  es un gran apoyo para ella y dos todavía están estudiando la universidad, ella a como pude busca la manera de no fallar la mensualidad de los estudios con sus ingresos como conserje desde hace varios años, doña Juana se separo de su esposo ahora ella sola vela por el bienestar del hogar y lucha para continuar la mejora de la infraestructura de su hogar. Con este crédito necesita cambiar el entechado que tiene varios orificios y con el invierno la pasarían muy mal si no se logra hacer dicho cambio, que solamente por medio de financiamiento puede realizar.
texts.en: Juana Paula is a woman struggling in life to cope and get ahead with her four children.  Two of her children are already working, which is a great support for her.  The two other children are still studying in university.  She does what she can, with her salary as a janitor the past few years, to look for a way not to miss the monthly school payments.  Ms Juana separated from her husband and now she alone looks after the welfare of the home and fights continually to improve the structure of the house.  With this loan she will replace the roof, which has various holes.  In the winter, they will have a tough time if they don't make this roof replacement, which is only possible through the financing of this loan.

loans.use: to buy corrugated steel and purlin wood frames to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Delmy Noemy

texts.es: Delmy, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Delmy lleva un año de tener su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios de consumo diario como ser: frijoles, maíz, manteca, refrescos, churros, sal, pan, condimentos, azúcar, carne de pollo etc. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 21,000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio de productos como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, manteca, pan, refrescos, churros, dulces etc. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y convertirlo en un supermercado.
texts.en:
Delmy is 32 years old, a single mother, and has two children with whom she lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. 

For a year, Delmy has had her own small general store where she sells daily household products such as beans, corn, lard, drinks, chips, salt, bread, condiments, sugar, chicken, etc. 

She has requested a loan of 21,000 lempiras so that she can further stock her store with products such as sugar, rice, beans, lard, bread, soft drinks, chips, candy, etc. Her goal is to make her business grow and convert it into a minimart.

loans.use: To further stock her business with products such as sugar, rice, beans, lard, bread, soft drinks, chips, candy, etc.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса уже несколько раз обращалась за финансовой помощью к КИВА. С момента получения предыдущего кредита от КИВА Раиса закрыла две свои точки и открыла одну новую в самом центре города. Она смогла это сделать за счет скопленных от ведения бизнеса средств.  
В этот раз ей понадобилась сумма в размере 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новый вид продуктов-купальников и пополнить ассортимент в новой торговой точке. За счет расширения предложенной продукции Раиса сможет увеличить круг покупателей и соответственно поднять свой доход.
texts.en:
Raisa has repeatedly turned to Kiva for financial help. On receipt of the previous loan from Kiva, Raisa closed two of her retail spots and opened one new one in the heart of the city. She was able to do it at the expense of accumulated funds from the business. 
 
This time, she needed a sum of 24,000 hryvnia to purchase a new kind of swimwear products and to fill the new outlet. By expanding her product offering, Raisa will be able to increase the number of buyers and thus raise her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new kind of swimwear products and to fill the assortment in the new retail outlet

loans.name: Transito Alberto

texts.es: Transito de 54 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una venta de jarrones y otras obras artesanales es muy conocido por la zona pues su trabajo es muy artístico, bonito, de excelente calidad y sobre todo a muy buen precio, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente y no quiere decepcionarlos,  quiere abastecer mas su negocio con las artesanías que realiza, por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura, y barniz. Transito tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia,
texts.en: Transito, 54, lives with his partner and their children.  He makes and sells traditional crafts products.  His products are known locally for their quality, beauty and value.  He has picked up many new customers recently and doesn't want to disappoint them.  He is applying for a loan so that he can increase his inventory and he will use the loan to buy clay, paint and varnish.  Transito is confident that the business will provide a stable income for his family and, in turn, a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crafts business.

loans.name: Teresa Benita

texts.es: Doña Teresa es una señora trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, actualmente se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo ya que es un negocio que le da como resultado buenas ganancias y que es muy buscado por sus vecino ya que es un producto de primera necesidad para todos diariamente y es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, Doña teresa solicita un prestamo para la compra de maíz por mayor para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hard-working and enterprising woman who lives in her own house with her husband and their children. Currently she sells tortillas from her home, and has been doing this for several years.

She works from Monday to Sunday, as it is a business that provides her with good earnings and which is very popular with her neighbors. This is because the product is a daily household necessity for everyone, and she is a very hard-working and friendly person. 

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale, so that she can continue making her tortillas. This way she can earn more, so that she and her family can have better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale

loans.name: Natasha

texts.ru: Наталия в очередной раз обратилась за помощью к КИВА. В этот раз Наталия планирует вложить сумму в 5 000 гривен в закупку сумок, ремней, за счет чего надеется увеличить и разнообразить свой ассортимент. Наталия не любит останавливаться на достигнутом, постоянно стремится двигаться дальше, поднимаясь на новый уровень развития своего бизнеса, тем самым также улучшая жизнь своей семьи.
texts.en: Nataliya has once again turned to Kiva for help. This time Nataliya plans to invest an amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy bags and belts, thereby hoping to increase and diversify her product range. Nataliya does not like to stop there, constantly striving to move further, rising to a new level of development for her business, thus also improving the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags and belts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 48 años de edad , esta casado con Betty, juntos tienen 3 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia.  Moises se dedica a la agricultura, todos los dias cuida de sus cultivos de papa, avena y olluco (productos agrícolas) que siembran en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos productivos y otras tantas que alquila en temporadas, ya tienen 21 años dedicándose a ello y juntos hacen posible para mandar el dinero suficiente a sus hijos. Moises desea comprar otra casa, donde planean poner una tienda de comestibles y alquilar cuartos.Éste es el cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo finaciero brindado razón por la cual se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Moisés invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Moises, 48, and his wife, Betty, have 3 children, all of whom live at home.  Moises operates a farming business.  He grows potatoes, beans and olluco on 2 hectares of farmland than he owns and additional land that he leases.  He has farmed this way for 21 years and he and his wife have done everything they can to provide for their children.  Moises wants to buy another house where he will set up a grocery and rent rooms.  This will be his fourth KIVA loan and he says that he is very grateful for the support that he's had from past loans.  He is committed to repaying this loan on time.  Moises will use your S/.2000 soles loan to buy organic manure to prepare his land for his next crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es: Doña maria vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan frances y sale a venderlo por la colonia donde ella reside. Doña Maria solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas para hornear y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her two children in their own house. She is a very responsible, hard-working and honest woman. She works in her own bakery where she makes sweetbreads and French breads, and goes out to sell them around the neighborhood where she lives. 

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can purchase flour, lard, baking containers, and everything necessary so that she can produce more baked goods. This improvement project for her bakery is very important for her, as this way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, baking containers, etc.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq owns a small dairy farm in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, which is the only source of income for his family. He has three buffaloes, which is insufficient to earn a good amount of income and sustain the lives of his family. Therefore he wishes to purchase two more animals so that he can get more milk to sell and earn a good amount of income.

Tariq has requested a loan amount of 100,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cattle for his business. He does not want his children to spend their lives as he did.  Therefore he wants to provide quality education to his children so they can lead respectable and good lives in the future. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for his dairy farm business.

loans.name: Abiana

texts.es: Abiana, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada,  vive con sus dos hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar mercadería para su posterior venta. Ella tiene pensado comprar  mercadería al mayoreo para que le sea más cómodo y obtener más ganancias y poder vender la mercancía en el mercado de la localidad y alrededores,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Abiana is 30 years old and is married. She lives with her two children and her husband. She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise which she will resell. She has thought about buying merchandise at wholesale so that she has a better profit margin and so that she can sell her goods in the local market as well as nearby areas. This will allow her to have good profits and improve her economic stability and quality of life. 

This is the first loan she has received through FUDECOSUR. She has never taken out loans with other financial institutions, but FUDECOSUR provides loans with an easier application process and an interest rate that is much lower than other institutions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Wuendi Yumila

texts.es: Wuendi, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, vive con su conyugue en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 4 años que ella se dedica al comercio, su negocio es venta ambulante de ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa intima para damas, caballeros  y niños. Ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de ropa y otra mercadería que le pidan los clientes. Va comprar ropa usada para la venta como pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa intima para damas y ropa de niños. Tiene como fin crecer con el negocio para poderles dar un mejor futuro a su familia y tener mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Wuendi is 34 years old, married, and lives with her spouse in the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Bárbara. She has been working for four years now selling clothing from door-to-door and place-to-place. She sells clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants and underwear for women, men and children. She is requesting a third loan of 10,000 HNL to stock her business with clothing and other merchandise that her customers request. She buys secondhand clothing to sell, such as pants, shirts, blouses, women’s undergarments and children’s clothing. Her goal is to grow her business to improve her family’s future and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell, such as pants, T-shirts, blouses, women’s undergarments and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Alamar

texts.es: Alamar  tiene  56  años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Alamar is 56 years old, married and lives with his wife. With the loan, he intends to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pest-control sprays, and at the same time hire laborers to help him. 

He plans to maintain his plantings so that they won't suffer any damage, and production won't be lost. This way, with his coffee-growing project he will be able to generate more income to contribute to his family. 

He doesn't have the necessary capital for this purchase nor for this hiring, as he is a low-income person and does not have the means to acquire the  money necessary for this. So he applied for a loan. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He had not had other loans before from regular banks, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 53-year-old mother from Kisumu City. She is married to Javan, who is a business man. They have three children who are grown; they are 28, 26, and 22 years old, respectively.

Fridah has a poultry farm where she keeps chickens of different varieties. She has been doing this business for the last 20 years and makes a monthly income of 51,100 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to pay school fees for her child who is in college and also buy poultry feed.

Fridah is hoping to run a successful business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child and also buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish house improvements.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene la edad de 40 años, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que María se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María is 40 years old, divorced with two children.  She wants a loan for the purchase of livestock for breeding, as they are great to sell and make a profit. The cattle business will help her and her family to get ahead. It is the first time that María is to be financed by FUDECOSUR.  She mentioned that the credit committee has been very helpful to facilitate the loan. She hopes that this project will achieve its objectives and grow in the future, in order to give her family a better quality of life and improved economic stability.  This is her first loan received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with a much lower interest rated and better terms.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмуроду 40 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 11 лет назад он начал свой бизнес куплей продажей женской одежды. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У него тонкий вкус и он умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все его достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет его быть внимательным и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Он должен купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  8000 сомони для покупки товара для нового сезона. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Saidmurod is 40 years old. He is married and is raising two children. In order to provide the family with all the necessary facilities, 11 years ago he started his own business buying and selling women's clothing. His efficiency helps him to be successful in his business. He sells his goods on the local market and has a large number of customers. He has good taste and knows how to choose products that have great demand. 

Despite all his advantages, the powerful competition of the business world forces him to be considerate and to update items every season. He has to buy goods for the new season, but does not have the sufficient means to do so. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy goods for the new season. He is awaiting the kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 57 years old. She has four adult children who are workers, beverage sellers and engineers. She and her husband grow vegetables to earn a living. He earns about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. Lan’s income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for eight years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND (or about 476 US dollars) per month. 

Lan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables. She is always hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga is 35 years old. She has three children, who are learning in the first grade, the fifth grade and the eighth grade. Her husband is a construction material driver. His income is 6,000,000 VND per month. Nga raises chickens and works as an assistant for her husband, to earn a living.  She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this work for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the previous loan cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to expand the pigsty and to raise her children up well.

Other members who are part of Nga's group include the following: 

  Hong is 20 years old. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
  Ha is 29 years old. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
  Pha is 38 years old. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
  Oanh is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 
  Loan is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 26 years old and lives at Nyamasaria, in Kisumu. She is a single mother of two children, who are twins and five years old. She has a retail shop within her area of residence, which she has been operating for the past one year. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use it to purchase goods in bulk to resell at her shop, like sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and bar soap. She will use the anticipated profit to grow the current business. She has a dream of opening a wholesale in town, and a goal to take care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase goods to resell, like sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and bar soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a plot of land and seeds to plant organic vegetables and grow fruit trees for plantation season.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin, a 39-year-old farmer, is married to Sarlince, 34. They are blessed with four children: Daniel,13, and Daud,11, are in elementary school. Yendrit, 5, is in kindergarten, and Marselus is 4.

To make a living, Kevin cultivates cassava and sweet potato at his farm. In addition, he is raising pigs and cattle. 

Kevin has planned to buy more piglets to raise, and a used motorcycle for ojek (motor taxi transportation).  He has requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and a used motorcycle for ojek (motor taxi transportation).

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace tres años que empezó a vender ropa como blusas, camisas, calcetines, y ropa intima para damas y caballeros. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en su comunidad y alrededores. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar más mercadería y ofrecer a sus clientes. Va comprar ropa variada para damas, caballeros y ropa interior. Su sueño es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para darle calidad de vida a su familia y tambien poder construir un local para establecer el negocio.
texts.en: Jovita is 36 years old, married and has two children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. She has always worked as a merchant.  As of three years ago, she started selling clothes such as blouses, shirts, socks and underwear for ladies and gentlemen.  She makes her sales as a mobile street vendor in her community and nearby.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to buy more goods to offer to her customers. She will buy various clothes for both men and women, as well as underwear.  Her dream is to increase sales and profits to give her family a better quality of life and also to build a permanent stand to stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy various clothing for both men and women, as well as underwear.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is 38 years old. He lives in Balichi village, Bolnisi district, with his 29-year-old wife Nino and retired father. Aleksi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where potatoes, maize, and haricot are grown. Also, the family owns a milk cow, which is milked every day to make dairy products. All the products are sold together at the local markets. Family additional income is Aleksi’s father's monthly pension.  

Aleksi requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Aleksi will purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop. His family will be selling the products from the shop themselves so they don’t have to have the extra expense of paying a salary to the seller. This will significantly increase their profit. He will be reinvesting part of the profit into purchasing more grocery stock in order to have better choices to offer to the clients. The other part, Aleksi will use for covering family monthly expenses and providing better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is 41 years old. She lives alone in Zerti village, Gori district. Liana applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan applications were rejected all the time, because of her low income and poor living conditions. Liana owns a small plot of land. She grows vegetables and sells them at the local markets to earn a small monthly income, which is her only source of income. Liana has applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Liana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Liana will start trading in clothes. She owns a small commercial space which will be used as a shop. Liana will buy men’s and women’s clothes from the big market at wholesale prices and sell them in her shop with a price markup. This will give her an opportunity to earn a better income and develop a new business. With the increased income, Liana will be able to provide better living conditions for herself.

loans.use: to start trading in clothes by buying wholesale and selling in her shop with a markup.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадине 33 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 6 лет назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей риса на местном рынке. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов на местном рынке и старается удовлетворить потребность своих клиентов. Ее клиенты, как местные жители, так и владельцы кафе, которые приготавливают и продают национальную еду "плов". Ее клиенты довольны ею, так как у нее высококачественный товар. Она является основной кормилицей в семье, так как ее муж простой рабочий и зарабатывает мало денег. Уже несколько лет она планирует купить мебель для своей комнаты, но не может делать сбережения, так как все свои деньги она тратит для покупки не обходимых средств. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 Cомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Madina is 33 years old. She is married with three children. In order to provide the family with all the necessary means, she started a business six years ago buying and selling rice in the local market. She has regular customers in the local market and is trying to meet the needs of her customers. Her customers are locals and cafe owners who prepare and sell national "pilaf" dishes. Her customers are pleased with her because she has a high-quality product. 

She is the main breadwinner for the family, as her husband is a simple work and earns little money. For several years, she has been planning to buy furniture for her rooms, but she is not able to save because she spends all her money buying the necessities. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for two years. Her husband is formally employed.

Josephine learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and the high cost of transport.

Josephine is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy grocery stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her child. She aspires to open a mini-wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Altanshagai

texts.en:
Mr. Altanshagai is 26 years old and lives with his wife, Uurintuya, and two-year-old son, Togsbileg, in an apartment in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. He used to help his father to run a transportation service business, back and forth between the province and the province center. He has gained a lot of experience in long-distance driving with his father.

He has married and moved out of his parents' house, and now he is starting his own business providing transportation services, inter-city, to cover his family's living expenses. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT. He will use the loan to purchase wheels and tires for his mini-van, with which he will provide inter-city, passenger transportation services. He is a hardworking, neat and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and tires for his mini-van, which he will use to provide transportation services

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en:
John Baptist is a permanent resident of Katembe in the Isingiro district; he is married with nine children. 

John Baptist is a farmer with banana plantations. The plantations give him a fairly good source of income, because the market is quite large. Bananas (matooke) are a staple food for most people in the western part of the country where John Baptist has his farm. So he sells to both locals and traders who come from the city. 

His hard work has not been in vain, because from the fruit of his labor, he has managed to save and to buy land as well as to support his family and dependents. 

John Baptist is constructing a house on his newly acquired land, and is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete it.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Haind

texts.en: Haind is a 32-year-old married woman who has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. All her life she has been working hard and earning money to assist her husband to provide for their family. She is a kind woman who works as an employer in the Water & Environment Ministry making a low salary. Her salary is not enough to cover household expenses.
